Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: Wal-Dawg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across the street from the train and bus stations. Very easy to find food and drinks. The rooms are cheap but they are perfect for crashing on a backpacking trip. Big bathrooms. Small TV. In room fridge. Two guys working at the front desk were super friendly. Not the most romantic place to take a girl but perfect for passing out for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Classic business-type hotel in an old Spanish style building”
Reviews.Author: kaputnik
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during the scorching summer in Madrid.. Location: Fantastic, across Atocha Renfe Station (building is visible from the station itself) so perfect to lug a trolley luggage straight from the airport express bus which alights there. Atocha Metro is like 50 meters away. Behind it there is the Reina Sofia Museum & Plaza with American outlets (for all Americanophilies) like Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Macs, Burger King next to or around the block. Plenty of Spanish tapas bars & eateries along the stretch as well. Walking distance to Retiro Park & Prado Museum. Amazing. Hotel & Room: Housed in a classic Spanish Style building with exterior and interior deco and old-school european lifts. Pretty large room for in European terms with comfy beds, spacious bathroom and amenities like flat-screen TV, mini-bar, hairdryer etc. Minimal noise from the corridors or streets (room was facing the main road). Air-conditioning was functional and was able to be switched on at full blast. Do not bother to try the breakfast when there are plenty of culinary options abound nearby the hotel!! My gripe: Signal of Wi-fi in the room was not as consistent as hoped - no problem, hop on over to Macs nearby for patatas (fries or wedges) and voila! Wi Fi gratis! (strong signal and free!!) Staff: Friendly and helpful enough (as mentioned, the African gentlemen was the most helpful) and most staff could speak English or rather able to understand any form of rusty Spanish like mine. Nutshell: Location of hotel triumphs everything with quite affordable, cosy and comfy rooms for a summer stay in Madrid. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cozy and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: kimlw1321
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a tour group last month and found it to be a conveniently located, comfortable hotel with no frills - ideal for our purposes since we didn't spent much time in the room anyways. The rooms were large, and quite cozy and charming, with plenty of room for 4 girls to move around. My only complaints were with the bathroom - the shower was extremely odd, with the showerhead located smack-dab in the center of the shower, so it sprayed out into the bathroom and pretty much flooded it. The hairdryer was also pretty useless, as it barely emitted any heat! The continental breakfast also could have been a bit better- it consisted of a croissant and a large roll (carb overload)- but I'm not too picky as long as I get my coffee. :) Again, the location was great...there was a Starbucks and several little sandwich shops right next door, and world-famous nightclub Kapital was also a short stroll which we all enjoyed! Certainly not upscale, but completely worthy of a short stay in a central Madrid location.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Receptionist”
Reviews.Author: JuanEsquivo
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, but one of the receptionists was pointlessly rude. When I arrived, I greeted him politely and he completely ignored me while he spent about five minutes completing a clerical task. Not so much as an acknowledgement of my being there! Again, when I left I spoke politely to him and he completely ignored me. I've no idea why he behaved like that, but clearly he's in the wrong job.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: D A
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in April 2011, the location is excellent but our room was infested with cockroaches

Reviews.Title: “Good Access. ok price.”
Reviews.Author: Mizuho_Kamata_Kato
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night, just for a short time. 108 Euro for a triple room on Saturday. ( we wanted double but no double then) We chose this hotel since we arrive at Madrid late in the evening and leave early in the next morning by train.This hotel is very close to Atocha station and also to prestigious museums such as Prado and Sophia so this hotel is recommended to travelers who's main purpose is to visit these places. It's giant hotel so group of tourists stay here so don't expect that too kind service but it is totally fine level. The room, too, not that fantastic but clean and convenient. The African guy at the front desk was very helpful to connect to Wifi and it was very smooth and fast. There're some places to eat nearby. One annoying thing was that it was quite noisy outside late in the evening. This hotel faces big road and also plaza at the back and seems many youngsters drinking at plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, A Nice Place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: nj-cool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as it was our accommodation for a tour that I went to for Spain. This hotel was great! The room was lovely and clean, nice and simple though it could have been a bit bigger. The bathroom was spacious however we had some issues with using the shower (the way the shower head was mounted caused water to spray out of the tub, we just took it down since it was hand held and used it). The room had a nice closet and a TV, though the TV could only be seen from the beds on one side. The staff of the hotel were great, they helped me with all of my requests with no problem, no complaints there. My only concern with this hotel is the need to return your room key to the front desk each time you leave and then to get it back simply say your room number to a staff member. This is fine, but its very simple for someone just to give a room number to them and get the key. The hotel's location is prime. Very close to everything most would like to see in Madrid, and should you need to go a bit further than a 25min walk, the metro station, train and taxis are all nearby. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here, this is a pleasant above average hotel in a great location, I would easily stay here again when I'm in Madrid next!

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: Mustaine2011
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Madrid near Atocha railway station this hotel is an excellent choice to establish your headquarter to visit Madrid and other cities around Madrid (like Toledo) Metro station is just outside the hotel door, Atocha is 100 m away, all the major Madrid attractions are in a circle of 30 min walking. Reina Sofia museum is 30m away. The hotel itself is located in a very beautiful old building with main entrance faced Atocha railway station and the other face Reina Maria plaza My room was spacious oriented through Reina Maria (very nice view). Furniture is old, same it is the floor, but the bed is very comfy. Bathroom is modern. What I have to remark is cleanness. Was perfect clean which is a big big up for this hotel. I did not had any meal so I can not review this point. Final words: if you are looking for a very decent hotel to start exploring Madrid and around with a great value for your money this is the place. Definitely this is 3 starts, not 2 stars If you are expected luxury try to look somewhere else. Negative: the walls; you may hear any noise from the neighbor rooms. Also elevator is old and elevator door was always full of static electricity. I was electrified every time when I touch to open the door.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay at budget price”
Reviews.Author: daha_no1
Reviews.Content: For what we paid, 100EUR for two nights over weekend, I think this hotel provides excellent value for money. If you are expecting greatness, pay more. The hotel is right on the Atocha square, great access to the main train station and express buses that go to the Airport. The room was small but had a nice view from the 5th floor over the square at the back over the Reina Sofia museum. Bed was comfortable, but use the air con rather than opening the windows as we found it a trap for mosquitoes. Free Wifi worked very well. Things to be aware, leave your luggage at your own risk, the door wasn't locked meaning anyone could get in and take your stuff, also don't arrive too early as your room won't be ready.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Suzy1284
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mediodia hotel for three days with my friend. I think it is very convenient for budget travelers who also like a touch of style in there stay. The rooms are of an average size, the bathrooms are clean and the service is very good. The hotel's surrounding area is not very interesting but it is near many interesting areas. The metro and the bus stations are 3 minutes walk from the hotel. There is also a couple of museums that you can reach in a 15 minutes walk. I liked the hotel, it was very convenient and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lacking in service area”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only a few blocks from the bus station and did have a small balcony overlooking the plaza which was nice. I found the room to be only adequate which may have been ok had the service not been so poor. I found the staff at the front desk to be somewhere between "I don't care" and "downright rude". They seemed in no hurry to help us when we were standing at the counter waiting politely for their help. When they did help us it was quite clear they were more interested in talking and laughing on the phone, talking to each other or talking to other customers than they were in helping us. I don't know if this is acceptable behavior throughout Europe (don't think so because they were great in Paris) but here in the US I am used to better.

Reviews.Title: “Great two-star hotel near Atocha train station_Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Bazilu25
Reviews.Content: October 2011: Just returned from holiday in Madrid. We stayed at this great two-star hotel just across the street from the Atocha train station. Perfect location, friendly staff, good price, clean and nice rooms. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, average room”
Reviews.Author: ahtsguy
Reviews.Content: This was the first of seven hotels we stayed at during our three weeks in Spain, and our least favorite. Not terrible—just average, not special. The room was clean and adequately sized with modest furnishings, and the bathroom was fairly large with a tub/shower combo that sprayed quite a bit of water on the floor (after first using it, we figured out that holding the spray wand while adjusting the water temperature and pressure minimized flooding). Wi-fi worked well, and the room was quiet for the first two nights (even with heavy traffic in the street below); but on the third (final) night, a bunch of partiers took over the adjacent room and management did little to quell the noise. One nice touch: the breakfast—just coffee, juice, dry cereal, fruit and pastries—included gluten-free muffins, which was much appreciated by my spouse.

Reviews.Title: “be pleasant to staff and they'll help you.”
Reviews.Author: marshall h
Reviews.Content: staff are cool as long as your pleasant enough with them.some are struggling to pay mortgages right now and take care of their kids etc so as i said,be cool with them and they are more than helpful.i don't speak a word of spanish and travelled alone but they did whatever they could to help me.stayed along the gran via another time,now that's a different story.BEWARE.sharp people waiting to part you and your $$$$$

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, FANTASTIC LOCATION IN MADRID”
Reviews.Author: CMO'H
Reviews.Content: Right opposite Atocha station, so ideal for people travelling to or from southern Spain or Barcelona on the AVE (high speed). Grand exterior, small but spotless rooms at a very good price. A bit less enjoyable in the winter, if one wants to spend time in the room, but for the most part, a trip to Madrid involves being out doing things most of the time. Staff are friendly and polite -- they serve breakfast but I tend to go to a cafe right by and have a really delicious Madrid breakfast of hot chocolate and churros. I use this hotel regularly and can wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chelseaewerner
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff did not speak much English, but they were patient with my bad Spanish and mostly very kind. The cleaning staff did a good job, our room was tidied every day. I shared a room with my three friends, so there were four twin beds in our room. It was actually quite roomy for all of us, and the bathroom was big enough for four girls to get ready in every day. We had a beautiful window that opened to the main street, and it was beautiful. The location was GREAT. Right down the street from Kapital night club, which is a must for any college age tourist. The breakfast was very meager, and the woman who served the breakfast was quite rude. The breakfast was just two types of pastry, some soggy cereal, and coffee. You definitely get what you pay for. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't a feast either. I liked the perfect location and adorable room best, and the rude server least. FREE WIFI!! It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: flapydog
Reviews.Content: We did spend one night in this hotel as is very close to Atocha train station. Hotel inside is clean and rooms comfortable, we enjoy the little balcony facing museum. Morning breakfast are good and served quick. One minus is small lift for someone who don’t like confined spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Great location for travelling.”
Reviews.Author: GrainneU
Reviews.Content: Booked mediodia solely for the location as we had an early train to catch from Atocha. Having read the reviews I wasn't expecting much but the €30 each for the night I didn't mind. On arrival I could see why some said that it was noisy as the front of hotel faces onto a very busy main road. However once inside reception we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were friendly and very helpful with suggestions of where to eat/drink, the hotel room was perfect. We were given a room with four single bed for three people. The room looked over the square and the music blared through our balcony windows when they were opened but once closed there wasn't a sound to be heard. Genuinely impressed with the place and would highly recommend it for anyone who needs a hotel close to Atocha station. The metro stop is right outside the door while the mainline station is a two minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Price, and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: BruceLex
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Hotel Meliodia, and it suited me just fine, although my traveling companion was somewhat less than impressed. The rooms are nothing to brag about, but are clean, and we had a very nice balcony view of a plaza behind the hotel. The bathroom was sparkling clean, and had apparently just been renovated. It looked like it should be in a 4-star hotel, I'm not kidding. The staff was OK, but not overly friendly. I managed to leave my sport coat hanging in the closet, and didn't realize it until 24 hours later. When I called, and they had it waiting for me at the front desk. You can't beat the location, right across from Atocha Station, and the price is nice. It's also a historic hotel, with a lot of character. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: MelissaTX
Reviews.Content: A VERY well located hotel just minutes away from the Prado museum, botanical gardens, and literally next door to the Reina-Sofia Museum. The location really makes this hotel. We arrived as a group of 39 travelers and wanted to check in. We were met with quite a bit of hostility at the front desk. They obviously deal with groups all the time, but they treat us like second class citizens. Many of our rooms weren't ready and we really didn't have any choice but wait. When we finally got into our rooms, we were glad there is an elevator. The rooms had AC which was great. The view from my room was spectacular. We could see major landmarks as well as sunset. So, the comfortable but basic room with the large bathroom made up for some of the delay at the front desk. The shower has a small half wall of glass but a lot of the tub/shower is open to the bathroom. I accidentally shot water from the shower out and got the floor wet. My towels were used to mop up my mess. I called and asked for additional towels because of the mistake and I was told "You are with a group, so no more towels for you!". I couldn't believe I wasn't given an options. Breakfast at this hotel is really lacking. We were given a croissant and a large very hard piece of bread. You also have the option of cereal. The 2nd morning we were having breakfast, the kitchen worker came out and yelled at my whole group in Spanish. She told us we couldn't read and were stupid. She was very angry and belligerent. She was upset because we sat at the wrong tables; little did we know they had changed where they wanted us to sit from the previous day. There was no need for her anger. Our room was pretty quiet because we faced out to the main huge street (sounds backward right?), but the rooms that faced toward the back and side of the hotel found the noise levels very high at night. The back of the hotel faced an area where people congregate at night and make a lot of noise. The safe in my room didn't work so I called down and someone was sent to my room right away who replaced the batteries. The 2 people who came to my room were very nice and could give the breakfast area and front desk staff some lessons in customer service. I loved that there was free Wi-Fi that actually reached all the hotel rooms and not just the lobby. That was a big plus! We just had to ask the front desk for the code. Overall, I'd stay here again because of location but I don't like the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor breakfast, noisy on the floors”
Reviews.Author: Ashley077
Reviews.Content: We took 2 rooms in this hotel. We choose it because of the location. The stuff is not very friendly and helpful. Since the first night, my parents could not sleep in their rooms in night times because of the people on their floor made noises until the morning, eventhough the noise was too much and all floors were disturbed, the hotel management does not do anything about the complaint. They do not even tell you they will warn the guests. After 3 nights, we had this kind of group on our floor and we couldnt sleep a night eventhough we did complain too. Nobody did stop them. Basically, if you plan to be noisy and wont sleep, you can choose this place, because noone will stop you in here :)

Reviews.Title: “great location, dingy and noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: reidlf
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mediodia has a great location, close to the train station and museums but it's noisy and the rooms are dingy and run down. The bedspreads and blankets have cigarette burns / holes in them and there are dust balls in every corner. The walls are not soundproof so you can hear the conversations in the neighbouring rooms and footsteps above. The room was cheap but I wouldn't stay here again. For a bit more you can get a lot better. Not sure how this hotel got 2 stars. Free and fast Wi-Fi was the only benefit to staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Amazing Hotel Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon3311
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Madrid and chose a hotel near the museums. After reading the reviews, I requested a room on the top floors in the back for quiet. To my lovely surprise, the terrace door opened to the Reina Sofia Museum courtyard. It was a small, modern, clean European type room, which was perfect for one or two people. Most of the staff spoke English well, and were so accommodating. They always had smiles and were genuinely helpful. I returned to the hotel after a week of traveling and they gave me the same room I'd had because I requested it. Also, it is across the street (really about a half block) from the Atocha Bus/Train Station so I could walk to catch the Renfe to Cordoba/Sevilla and also it only cost $2EU to take the bus from the airport and then I could see the hotel from the bus station. Also, the Atocha subway was in front, as well, and I had to travel out of the city. I took three subways and it was so easy and people were so helpful. I was so pleased with the location and it was peaceful. In the summer, however, it may be busier and louder. That's why I travel in the off season...winter, less people, but still because it was during the Christmas Holidays, there were quite a few travelers, and I would recommend purchasing a 3 Museum ticket, which is less than the price of one day at the Prado. You also do not have to wait in the long lines that are otherwise there if you already have a ticket. Also, the people at tourist office at the Reina Sofia Museum courtyard are so helpful and the staff at the Starbucks nearby is pleasant and friendly, as well. Also, Dunkin' Donuts is next door, which I found funny, being from Boston. Also, many food places next door and nearby, reasonable prices. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Xanthe_75
Reviews.Content: I originally booked this hotel as a short overnight transit before catching a train to Pamplona (it is located directly opposite Atocha train station). We were so pleased with it that we stayed there two other times during our 7 weeks in Spain. Our first stay was in a fairly basic room, complete with creaky uneven floorboards. But it served its purpose perfectly. For our second stay we were upgraded to a deluxe room, which was large and light. On our third visit we had a room somewhere in between - not fancy but suited what we needed. The staff on reception are very helpful and speak english. The continental breakfast was basic but again all that we needed. The public areas in the hotel (reception, sitting room and breakfast room) are all very charming. The location is perfect for access to the metro, Atocha, Reina Sofia, Prado and Retiro.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road, but not mediocre”
Reviews.Author: skgronholz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a chaperone with a group of high school students traveling through Spain with EF. The location is excellent, as the hotel is situated across from Atocha train station, next to the Reina Sofia modern art museum (a must-see), and near a metro station. The rooms are surprisingly roomy, with ample storage for suitcases and a satisfactory bathroom. Construction noise woke me early in the morning, but such nuisances come with a city undergoing restoration. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to those who aren't expecting the best or the worst but desire a comfortable room in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay right across from the train station”
Reviews.Author: AlbertCav
Reviews.Content: Had an good stay for one night between Sevilla and Barcelona in March 2010. Room was clean and beds reasonably comfortable. Bathroom was clean with good towels. The hotel advertises its soundproofing, and found the description accurate - we could not hear the heavy traffic outside, and spent a quiet night in bed. We did not experience unruly kids staying at the hotel like other reviewers. There were TONS of kids mulling around the lobby in the morning, so I can confirm the use of the hotel by school tour groups. We had requested a quiet room away from the kids explicitly in our reservation, and they accommodated this request, so I recommend you do the same. Night staff was very friendly, but the man at the day desk was the exact opposite - the rudest behavior I've had as a quest. Not cultural - everyone else was extremely friendly in Spain even tho we did not speak any Spanish. Not a charming hotel, but clean and neat. All about location - right next to the Rena Sofia museum and just down the street from the Prado. There was a hop-on hop-off bus (highly recommended) stop right across the street, and we used this to get around as we were only in Madrid the day. The back faces the courtyard of the Rena Sofia, where there were a number of restaurants - sorry, can't recommend names, but enjoyed an Italian restaurant there. Note the courtyard felt a little unsafe late at night with lots of teens hanging there, so have your wits about you. All and all I would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, clean but small room”
Reviews.Author: RaquelPonsati
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this nice hotel, just in front of Atocha's station, my room was a little bit small, but nice and very clean, I was alone, so I didn't need more space. The shower was nice, towel and bed linen spotless. There's a lot of cafes and restaurants close, Museo del Prado and Parque del Retiro are just a few minutes walking. Staff was friendly, I didn't have breakfeast, because there's a lot of other cafes close.

Reviews.Title: “alright but noisy”
Reviews.Author: woolnoughfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is called hotel midday in english because that is the time you get to sleep! At night time, the students are moving the furniture around constantly and having parties and putting loud music on and shouting in the hallways! Students are staying here while they are in Madrid because it is reasonably priced! I have to say though the crossiants were spectacular! The staff were very kind to us and let me and my family move to a higher floor because most of the students were on the 1st or 2nd or higher floors - it was alot more quiet on the third floor. If you are staying at hotel Mediodia stay on a high floor! In Madrid, the teenagers never go asleep they're still shouting in the streets at 6:00am so I wouldn't say it was the best location to put a hotel! The hotel got quieter each night because we were on a high floor and the beds were quiet comfortable for me, but my dad found them small as his feet used to stick out the end! Breakfast closes at 11:00am so i would advise you to get down there to have some delicious crossiants! There is also nesquick hot chocolate! If you stay at the back of the hotel you have a good view!!!!!!! By Sophie Woolnough (age 10)

Reviews.Title: “ideal”
Reviews.Author: kevinocallaghan
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor member Ireland Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and was impressed with the friendly reception staff . The rooms were clean especially the bathroom. beds were comfortable and bed linen changed everyday. Our room was to the front overlooking the plaza and therefore slighty affected by traffic noise, but ear plugs and extra alcohol sorted this and ensured a good nights sleep.Breakfast was continental which is all I required but if you are a big breakfast person there are cafes just outside the hotel.The location was ideal, metro station and Renfe station close by. only 20 minutes casual walk to Puerta del Sol. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fatbadger88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a uni trip for just under a week. I came with very low expectations the hotel itself was great. The rooms were large and clean (which is a big difference from the hotel we stayed in london). It was a quick trip from the airport and was on a metro line so we could go anywhere we wanted with low cost and ease. Pinocchio's is well worth a visit for food with friendly staff and good food. However It was very noisy at night though and the resturant food and staff was very poor. This hotel is mostly located among a lot of great art gallerys and the newly opened forum center is also worth a visit. There arn't too many resturants until you get to Sol but there are lots of great places there. If you want to go for a drink the Irish bars are the only places you can go really as the spanish mostly have parties in the street (which causes most the noise when there is about 200-300 people outside the hotel followed by a big cleanup opperation after) Via the train I would also reccomend a trip to toledo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: florida3122
Reviews.Content: I went on a tour with efcollegebreak and they booked us here. The hotel was great. The location was very good, you can see the modern art museum from your room, which is worth checking out. They have some great restaraunts around, which I reccomend Pinnochios. The staff was extremely friendly, they would always speak to me and help give me directions places. You can pretty much walk to most of the attractions in 20 minutes. The taxis are not too badly priced and they are lined up in front of the hotel. They do have free wireless internet there. The rooms are nice too, they are spacious and have a balcony with a view. The bathrooms are spacious too. Feel free to message me.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, i recomend”
Reviews.Author: luciend
Reviews.Content: i stayed there in may 21-26. the location was incredible. in front of atocha station, you can go everywere by metro. simple hotel, but polite staff, clean rooms, and my room was in the back of the reina-sofia museum. fantastic. a great view to a square with many people. many teenagers in school excursion. but i didnt ear any noise, and my room was beside a room with 5 teens.no problem to me. good price( 83 euros). breakfast was a negative point, but it seems to me that almost all hotels in madrid are like that. many places to eat beside. I RECOMEND.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you need to be near the train station”
Reviews.Author: schoir
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel only because it was across from the train station. I can only justify the price I paid (USED $140/night) because I wanted to be across the train station. The hotel room is what is like a boarding room/hideout from a scene in a movie -- old wood floors, old wood furniture, old wood door (with skeleton-like key) that seems like it would splinter with a good kick, old dark bathroom with old bathroom fixtures, [presumably old] lumpy bed. The one positive was that my room had a large window facing over the large square behind the hotel. The complimentary breakfast consisted of some rolls, juice and water. The reception staff was cold, distant and unhelpful. I dealt with the same man for both my check in and check out. His tag designated him a manager. In all my dealings with him (luckily they were very few -- only check in/out), he would not look me in the eyes. when I checked in, I was the only patron. Two problems immediately arose. First he couldn't find my hotel confirmation. Fortunately, I had a printout of my confirmation. Second, he said there was no room yet available and that it would be another 10-15 mins. before I could get one. I told him I would wait in the empty lobby at the lounge area 10 feet away from the reception desk. I reasonably assumed that he would alert me when the room was ready -- I was the only patron, sitting in an empty lobby -- but I was wrong. After waiting 40 minutes, I finally went over to ask him for a status on the room. He silently handed me the key, with no explanation, nothing. Check out was the same cold service, but no problems arose. Overall, stay here if you need to be near the train station. Otherwise, there are better and more centrally located places to stay in Madrid for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Closest to the Railway station”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: We found ouselves stuck in Madrid on New Year's Day as we had not booked train tickets to Barcelona in advance. As the next train we could get on left at 6.30 am we decided to stay as close to the station as we could - hence this hotel which is just across the road. It looks from the outside rather grander than it is on the inside. The laconic gentleman at reception kept us waiting for a couple of hours before handing over the keys to 2 rooms on the third floor. The rooms were clean enough although obviously previously inhabited by smokers. The double had one very small bed, the twin room was a little better. The bathrooms were elderly and stained but worked okay. The main problem was noise, not from outside but from the tiled floors, slamming doors and thin walls. Not condusive to a good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: IIvaanaa
Reviews.Content: Basic, cozy, reasonably spacious room with a charming balcony (a/c, tv, telephone, well-sized bathroom w hairdrier, but don't expect minibar, fridge, or fancy bathroom amenities). Spotlessly clean, sheets and towels changed daily. Great location / close to museums, tabernas and train station, if you want to explore beyond M. The square in front of the htl is quite busy but it isn't not noisy when balcony door is shut. Basic breakfast (croissants, coffee, juice) in a cozy restaurant. Staff was kind, no problems if you speak some Spanish. The only thing that I really missed in Mediodia was an internet corner.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price...”
Reviews.Author: luvmesometravel
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is conveniently located to the train station and several sights, it was not a grand end to our trip in Spain (to say the least!). While the A/C functioned very well and our room was a good size (with a balcony), the room walls were paper-thin, thus we could hear our neighbors next door as well as the many, MANY teenagers yelling and running down the halls. If you're looking for a quiet hotel, this is not the place for you. Not only can you hear the commotion within the hotel, but because of its central location, you can hear sirens and horns at all hours of the night. Additionally, we had to leave our key with the front desk each time we left our room, which was rather unnerving. One evening, we came home with three local friends as one had left some items she needed to pick up in our room before departing. One of the front desk men began yelling in Spanish, stating they could not come up with us...following us all the way to the stairs! The front desk was definitely not friendly. All in all, for a good location, the room is clean and serves the purpose for a decent price in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Priced, Small dated room”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBargains
Reviews.Content: We had missed the last train out for the evening from Atocha to where we wanted to go, so walked across the street from the train station, (as another poster noted, you should see the tropical garden inside the station, and you can watch live cameras of the area around it on trafficomadrid.com) Also, although it was only under construction when we were there, the glass memorial to the 11 March train bombing victims is located there. Anyway, we got a room for 79 Euros without a reservation, which was good. the lobby was full of relatively wild teenaged tourists, of which the hotel seemed to have an abundance. The room was small. It was clean, but the furnishings, from the sheets to the tv, climate control, to the bath fixtures were dated, but worked. One might say that the building has character though. On the plus there was a stone balcany off of the room that overlooked an interesting plaza on the back of the hotel. That plaza was occupied by groups of young folks until late in the night. I would think for young folks traveling on a budget, this would be an OK hotel to stay at. More seasoned travelers, and those used to more comforts may be annoyed with the furnishings, the noise, and the rickety elevator. It works if you find yourself missing the last train out for the evening though, and it is reasonable for Madrid in price. There are plenty of sidewalk cafes litterally right out in front, and I had a nice flavorful sandwich with jamon serrano at one of them, sitting eating olives and watching the pedestrians and traffic go by. Rich Hagen

Reviews.Title: “Really great budget option!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMaxx
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed at the Mediodia in Madrid. We had a two twins and a triple (although one twin was supposed to be a double - never mind!) Really nice hotel ... quite grand considering it is a budget option. Clean, comfortable and the staff were very helpful. There was plenty of hot water for showering and the breakfast was definately adequate - Coffee, Orange juice, a delicious Coisant and bread roll with butter and Jam. Each room has a lovely little balcony and my views were quite impressive - see photos attached. WARNING!!!! - a must see is the interior of the grand train station accross from the front of the hotel. But sadly ... whilst we were looking up in the station (you will see why if you go) ... my friend had her wallet and mobile phone nicked from her hand bag - they were serious proffesionals ... as we did not realise until we had left the area! So beware of these scum who prey on tourists - I suppose you get them in any major city. But the long and the short of it ... is that we had a fab time in Madrid .. and if I were to go again I would definately stay at the Mediodia again.

Reviews.Title: “huge thanks”
Reviews.Author: BILLY18
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a four day trip to Madrid. we had 30 art students with us and we could not have asked for more help from the hotel. they were calm and efficient at all times . we were able to work with the students within the hotel and they produced some lively, exciting large works in responce to what they had seen. thank you again for your professionalism

Reviews.Title: “Such a fun hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sofia_Winsor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Mediodia in spring of 2006 and I thought it was a great hotel. While it isn't completely luxurious, it's comfortable and beautiful inside. It's a historical building which will make your stay in Madrid even more exotic. While at the Hotel Mediodia, you feel the local culture. It's a great location with some of the rooms looking over a city square. The metro stations are close, there's a pharmacie right down stairs, and restaurants and museums in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jupata
Reviews.Content: GReat price, clean hotel, extremly helpful staff!! I loved and would highly recomend this to anyone!! Location for this price is unbeatable!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: neal1260
Reviews.Content: Opposite Otacha station [ have a look at the tropical rain forest inside the station ] where the Madrid bombings happened is this cheap and cheerful hotel. It`s 2 star and remember you get what you pay for. The rooms are small and confortable en suite with reasonable bathrooms. The bathroom had a window that opened into the lift shaft so if kids are with you beware. We had a balcony room at the front of the hotel. The double glazing blocks most of the traffic noise from a very busy road. You can watch all the happenings outside including the winos and tramps doing drug deals right outside the hotel, however they do not trouble you. The breakfast is continental, a croissant, bread roll, jam and butter with a cup of coffee. On you doorstep is many cafes, Dunkin Donut, KFC, Burger King and Mc Donalds. Half a mile away is Starbucks, Planet Rock and Hard Rock Cafe. Ideal budget hotel to base yourself to explore Madrid it is used by school parties [ bit noisy at night as kids are ]. Take your phrase book as only Spanish is spoken everwhere. Catch the open top bus outside the hotel get a day ticket to hop on and off at places you wish to visit. Enjoy an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Roaringdog
Reviews.Content: By European standards, I found the Mediodia Hotel to be charming and clean. We stayed there a while back and thought it was a delightful hotel. I did not think it was seedy looking in the slightest on the outside - It is simply an older hotel. Our room was with a balcony and was extremely airy, clean and charming. It was completely in white complimented with dark woods. The breakfast was quite good with as much orange juice as one could drink. The location was handy to everything - though the street can be a little noisy at night; we felt that was part of its charm. A good hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “It has it's goods and bads.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the facade may not be be the cleanest and most upkept, it's 19th century building is kind of neat. It was more then I expected from a 2 star hotel. It seemed fairly clean, however, it could use some maintenance. The rooms were kept up, but the 2nd floor lounge was falling apart. You could feel the springs in the chair, and the marble top of a radiator cracked in half when I set my popcorn chicken and Fanta Limon from KFC on it. There were also some major safety issues in this lounge. One of the 3 elevators has an outdoor shaft. This shaft is very accesible form a large window that swings open. A friend of mine (who is a little nutty) was able to climb on top of the elevator (while not moving)!!! The elevators were also a little frightening to ride. One of them rumbles loudly and vibrates excessivly on the upper floors. The room was nice. It was fairly bright and clean, and the hardwood floors were nice. I had a balcony overlooking the fountain/roundabout and Atocha station. While a tad loud, it is in the center of a major city afterall. The surrounding are is also nice. The Prado is within walking distance. There is also a park close by, but they charge admission!! It did get sketchy at night, however. I was frequently out past midnight, and a group of friends witnessed an armed mugging in front of the hotel. They were questioned by Madrid police and nothing furhter occured. THere was also a mass riot in front of the hotel that resulted in at least one overturend car. I also found myself wandering the back alleys because riots had filled Plaza Mayor and Sol, therby cutting of Metro service, so my friends and I had to get off at the next staion and find our way to Plaza Mayor on our own. This may all seem very scary, but overall it is a safe place. Keep in mind that this violence occured on the day the US declared war on Iraq and I did not have problems during the day. Prehaps the worst part of the hotel was the staff. The day staff seemed OK. The desk clerks were averge, could be friendlyer (however, the maid who did my laudry for me was one of the nicest people I met in Spain). But the night staf....oh boy. They were RUDE!!!! In spain, it is customary to keep ur room key at the desk when you go out. Upon arriving back to the hotel, the clerks seemed as though you were bothering them when you asked for your key. One night (at about 10PM, not horribly late) a girl from my school group asked me to help her make a phone call to the states. I had trouble, so I dialed 9 (in Spain, dial 9 for operator and 0 for an outside line) for the desk and asked how to go about contacting an international operator. The receptionist's reply was hard to understand, so I simply said I don't understand what ur saying. she finally began to scream at me, saying "YOU KNOW WHAT I AM SAYING! YOU CALL FROM GIRL"S ROOM! YOU A VERY BAD PERSON. I WILL TELL YOUR TEACHER! GO TO YOUR ROOM." she then hung up. My group leader communicated my displeasure to the staff, but I never recieved even so much as an apology. Some of the guests are a little rough too. A group of rather loud Italian students were causing disruption. A few mintes later the same rude receptionist came to MY room and pounded on the door. I opened it, and she COMMANDED me to shut up and go to sleep (again, this is at aobut 10 o'clock at night, not late for Madird). The Italians next door continued to be loud, and a British man in nuthing but his underwear came out in the hallway and yelled at me to tell the Italians to "SHUT THE *&%^ UP!."....sigh. I love the city and the country...but the hotel needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable at most, and I'm being generous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, well, I was with a group on a tour that would bring me to Madrid, Granada, Sevilla and the Costa Del Sol. EF the tour operator chooses the hotels about a month before your departure time so staying at the Mediodia was not an option. Altough I had fun with my friends, the Mediodia was ultra ordinary, with small rooms (cleanliness so-so), no air conditioning and a lack of hospitable and helpful staff. They were more on the "rude" side than anything else. Some parts of the hotel were crumbling and I had the pleasure to sit in a chair on the second floor that was literally glued back together. Oh, and be aware that like in many othels across Europe, they are no non-smoking rooms and so, I was stuck with an unpleasant cigar-like odor in my room during my stay as well as a wonderful mattress where I could feel the springs flirting with my back. Howewer the location is excellent and If you want a very cheap, well located hotel and you don't really care about what I mentionned, Hotel Mediodia is for you. Overall, not reccomanded, spend a few more bucks to get a decent mattress and a more helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay, not the best. It was at a great location, right across the street from the train station. You just have to watch out for pick-pockets outside. The only problems were that it was a little small and had no air conditioning. But that's whats to be expected in European hotels. It was, for the most part, clean and it had a continental breakfast that consisted of hard bread, a croissant, hot chocolate or coffee. But there's also a Dunkin' Doughnuts and a KFC nearby for those fast-food junkies and teenagers like myself. Most rooms had a small balcony and there was a nice seating area on the second floor. I would recommend it to most!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mediodia
HotelInfo.Address: 8 Plaza del Emperador Carlos V, 28012 Madrid, Spain
